Package DBAccess

Class DBCustomer

java.lang.Object
DBAccess.DBCustomer
public abstract class DBCustomer extends Object
A class containing several convenient functions for fetching and inserting Customers to and from the database.

  • Constructor Details

    • DBCustomer

      public DBCustomer()

  • Method Details

    • getAllCustomers

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Customer> getAllCustomers()
      Returns the set of all Customers in the database as an ObservableList. ObservableList are handy for attaching to GUI items such as ComboBoxes and TableViews.
      Returns:
      - An ObservableList of Customers.

    • customerExists

      public static Boolean customerExists(String customerName) throws Exception, SQLException
      Checks the database for a match of Customer name. Must be a complete match. string
      Parameters:
      customerName - - a customer name in string form
      Returns:
      - returns true if customer with matching name string can be found, false if no match found.
      Throws:
      Exception - - throws exception for poorly formed SQL
      SQLException - - throws excaption for poorly formed SQL

    • getCustomerByName

      public static Customer getCustomerByName(String customerName) throws Exception
      Returns the Customer in Database with matching String name. Throws exception if this Customer cannot be found. Developer can use customerExists() function in this class to check existence first.
      Parameters:
      customerName - - string the Customer name string.
      Returns:
      - matching Customer object
      Throws:
      Exception - - throws exception if Customer match cannot be found.

    • lookupCustomer

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Customer> lookupCustomer(String string)
      Searches the database for Customers with a match or partial match for name string. All Customers with Name strings containing the search string as a substring anywhere in the name will be returned. eg. If string is 'a', all Customers with names containing 'a' will be returned. Case-sensitive.
      Parameters:
      string - - search string
      Returns:
      - list of Customers with a match or partial match in name string with the search string.

    • lookupCustomer

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Customer> lookupCustomer(int id)
      returns the Customer with matching customer id.
      Parameters:
      id - - id number
      Returns:
      - customer object with matching id number.

    • deleteCustomer

      public static int deleteCustomer(int id) throws SQLException
      Deletes the Customer with matching id number.
      Parameters:
      id - - id number
      Returns:
      - rows affected. Will always be zero or 1 since Customer ids are unique.
      Throws:
      SQLException - - throws exception on poorly formed SQL, will not throw exception if Customer not found.

    • insertCustomer

      public static int insertCustomer(String name, String address, String postalCode, String phone, int divisionId) throws SQLException
      Creates and inserts a new Customer into the database.
      Parameters:
      name - - name string
      address - - address string
      postalCode - - postal code string
      phone - - phone number string
      divisionId - - division id string eg. "Texas", "New Jersey" etc.
      Returns:
      - rows affected. Will always be zero or 1.
      Throws:
      SQLException - - throws exception on poorly formed SQL

    • updateCustomer

      public static int updateCustomer(int id, String name, String address, String postalCode, String phone, int divisionId) throws SQLException
      Updates Customer in the database with matching id.
      Parameters:
      id - - id number
      name - - name string
      address - - address string
      postalCode - - postal code string
      phone - - phone number string
      divisionId - - division id string. eg. "Texas" "New Jersey" etc.
      Returns:
      returns rows affected. Will always be zero or one since Customer ids are all unique.
      Throws:
      SQLException - - throws on poorly formed sql
